info.game_comments:
Ben Ingram game 9.
Mark Japinga game 1.

(1, 1).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew delivers the clue.) I'm on 152nd Street at the famed Dance Theatre of this part of Manhattan

(2, 1).clue: The Black Pearl in the subtitle of this film had been Jack Sparrow's ship, lost in a mutiny

(5, 1).clue: This is the fraudulent taking of funds with which one has been entrusted

(6, 1).clue: A raspberry-filled glazed one of these from Krispy Kreme has 350 calories

(2, 2).clue: He had some trouble hiding his Scottish accent as a Soviet sub commander in "The Hunt for Red October"

(3, 2).correct response: the War between the States (or the Civil War)

(4, 2).clue: You get poor treatment if you get a "raw" one of these

(5, 2).clue: Objection! this, a statement by a witness about something he or she didn't see

(6, 2).clue: One of these tells you what is entailed if you are hired; mine includes interviewing contestants & reading clues

(1, 3).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew delivers the clue.) I'm in Bethel, New York, where this event took placein 1969; the nearby town for which the event was named refused to give permission

(2, 3).clue: Perched at the front of the Titanic, Jack shouts, "I'm" this!

(4, 3).clue: A rosy glow of the face

(5, 3).clue: This term doesn't mean you get extra parsley, rather that a third party withholds wages

(6, 3).clue: A classic Gary Cooper film is called "Meet" him

(1, 4).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew delivers the clue.) I'm in this city at the arena named for one local hero, Joe Louis, with the statue of another,Gordie Howe

(2, 4).clue: This Spielberg film recounts how in 1839 captive men on a slave ship freed themselves & killed most of the crew

(3, 4).clue: "A Farewell to Arms" by Ernest Hemingway

(4, 4).clue: 2-word term for why Joseph & Mary were refused lodging

(5, 4).clue: Oddly, this term for a trial postponement comes from the Latin for "uninterrupted"

(6, 4).clue: Usually arising before age 25 & now called type I is the disorder that used to be known as this

(1, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew delivers the clue.) California's boy scout Camp Winton is near a gold-bearing areacalled "the Mother Lode" in the foothills of this mountain range

(2, 5).clue: He played "Master and Commander" Jack Aubrey, Captain of HMS Surprise

(5, 5).clue: Thanks for not leaving a will, grandpa! Now you're considered this, & your goods are distributed by state law

(6, 5).clue: This term for a witty literary work means "game of spirit"

(1, 1).clue: "The least chip or crumb of the boats touched his skin, his tail swiftly drew back, and came sideways smiting the sea"

(2, 1).clue: 1st:A box of Crane ruled half sheets

(3, 1).clue: The 1948 airlift to this capital city was designed to thwart a Soviet blockade

(4, 1).clue: (Dan Patrick delivers the clue.) He turned down a $3.6 million contract from the Arizona Cardinals & later became a member of the 2nd Battalion, 75th Ranger Regiment

(6, 1).clue: A title cop played by Clint Eastwood, of all people, becomes the democratic Senate majority leader

(1, 2).clue: "I shall be your Beth still, to love and help you more than ever. you must take my place, Jo"

(3, 2).clue: Vercingetorix was the leader of this people of France defeated by Julius Caesar

(4, 2).clue: Amer-I-Can, founded by this 1960s Cleveland running back, has been helping inner-city kids for 25 years

(6, 2).clue: A Massachusetts female senator gets to the bottom of the JFK assassination as a group appointed on Nov. 29, 1963

(1, 3).clue: "Miss Havisham was alone. 'Well?' said she, fixing her eyes upon me. 'I hope you want nothing? You'll get nothing"'

(3, 3).clue: The 1st planned convict settlement in Australia was at this bay named for its abundance and variety of life

(4, 3).clue: This Red Sox legend had a brother who died of leukemia, helping inspire his timeless work with the Jimmy Fund starting in 1953

(6, 3).clue: A 1970s pitcher whose name precedes a type of arm surgery takes a Senate seat for Arizona

(1, 4).clue: "Mr. Earnshaw was sitting by the fire, deadly sick; his evil genius, almost as...ghastly, leant against the chimney"

(2, 4).clue: 12th:A dressing gown made of this, like a 19th century fop's

(5, 4).clue: All 4 gospels mention this Jewish prisoner whom Pilate freed instead of Jesus
